author: otaviolima
title: ADABet: Betting Site for Everything
description: Use your portfolio's ADAs to monetize through betting with everyday events and subjects, bringing utility, entertainment and profits.

f6_assessments.q0:
As an employee of an online gambling company can say, the idea will bring many new people to Cardano's ecosystem. Gamblers are not interested in currency, they just want to feel the adrenaline. Our company has the highest revenue during the pandemic because the real casinos were closed.
The proposal is very clear and well explained. Proponents know how their idea will help the community - "We know the gambling industry is moving billions, we hope to bring a significant amount of negotiations ...".
It is not very clear how the bet liquidity will be provided? At a certain moment, the winners can be much more than losers. Where will the money come from?  The proposers should know the answers to these questions
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers provide links to their LinkedIn accounts with further explanations of their experience. They are a very experienced and reliable team. The other good part is that there are different roles in the team. This is the definition of a complete team. CEO, full-stack developer, journalist, and marketing assistant. They are able to manage many areas of the project, not just development.
The budget is very well separated into different phases - that is why there are several questions that can be asked. 
1. What happens if the full stack developer can't / refuses to participate in the project? How will he be replaced?
2. There is only one developer why the budget is separated in front-end and back-end??
3. Only the fourth and fifth months are set for development. This means that the payment for one developer for two months will be 14k + 16.8k = 30.8k or about 15k per month. What is the salary of a regular/senior developer in Brazil?
4. Is it possible for such a project to be made by only one developer? How about deployment, networking, security, maintenance, technical support and etc? 
5. What exactly is included in Amazon AWS support? Why should the project be deployed at AWS? There are many other cheaper hosting services.
6. What is included in this marketing assistant and social media? Nothing mentioned in the "detailed plan and timeline"?
The proposals do not explain technical aspects such as architecture, language, and technology. There is nothing about how they will attract new people. Missing challenges and risks associated with successful implementation
f6_assessments.q2: There are no precise development measures. "Number of hits to the website, registered users, and bets created" are measurements of success, not progress. Perhaps the explanation here should be related to the development of the project. The answers for success are similar to those with progress. The "Numbers of bets created" are set for both KPIs - progress, and success. There is no clear description of the target problem and no clear solution that addresses the problem. The proposer has to put himself in the shoes of the voter before answering the questions.
f6_assessments.reply:
(Impact / Alignment Note) - Excellent questions, we really believe that we will be able to attract many new users to get to know Cardano. We will provide liquidity to the main betting groups, as they will be binary, we will always have the same ratio of winners x losers wins. We currently have 2 full stack developers with us, both with qualities in both front and back.

(Feasibility Note) - The salary of a senior developer in Brazil is around $4K/month. We believe that it is possible to use only one developer, but we think it is safe to have more people on the team to guarantee delivery. We already use AWS in all our projects, we have many resources already optimized and prepared. We will try to detail more information about user acquisition.

(Auditability Note) - With the feedback received, we will make the project follow-up public in JIRA, as well as posts on social networks and also a development release through news. Our average score for this topic was 3.5. We believe you could analyze the distance of the two note 1. Thank you very much for the support.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is not addressing the challenge since it is focused on developing a solution or an alternative to spend ADA tokens and it is not attempting to attract developers to the Cardano Ecosystem. 
Knowing this industry, the proposal explains the benefits of working on a solution to allow ADA holders to play a game of chance. 
According to how it is described, this is gambling since involves the three key elements to categorize a game as gambling: 
1) Consideration: When there is money (ADA) requested in order to play)
2) Chance: When the event is random and can not be controlled
3) Prize: They win something of value

In this case, a legal section should have been addressed on how to avoid falling into this category of games that are extremely difficult to operate. Most gambling operators have a license to run these games (example: in the UK is legal with a license, in the US is illegal depending on states and licenses)
f6_assessments.q1:
The team looks well experienced in other categories, with outside help it could execute the project, but creating a gaming platform of this level from scratch needs a lot of work, expertise, and time that is not described in the team experience. 
Most gaming platforms similar to the one described have been in the industry for many years with a lot of security methods behind them to avoid cheating and to allow the auditing of the randomness of the game. This proposal with the way it has been explained will be a little difficult to implement. Having said this, with the help of other Cardano members, this team could open great opportunities keeping in mind their experience in generating traffic to their site.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed method to measure progress is based on results and metrics of the final solution (number of bets, registered members, hits to the website), and it is not oriented to follow the roadmap of the development of the solution. By looking at the team, I am sure they can definitely better describe how the milestones in the timeline will be achieved but unfortunately, it is not reflected in the proposal.
It is important to differentiate the auditing of the project and the auditing of the achievements if the proposal is executed and in this case, there is a need for a tool to measure the progress of the work and not just the result.
In the future, the KPIs will need to also reflect roadmap deliverables connected to the money spent on a monthly or weekly basis.

f6_assessments.q0:
First, I would like to comment on the idea of this project. This is indeed an exciting and creative idea to attract users to Cardano. The form of betting is simple and close, the way to pay prizes with smart contracts is also very potential for development. But, like luck in betting games, I'm not sure this project will last long if your team can't control the content in each betting game because it is very likely that the content will affect sensitive issues related to the law and personal life of others.
Next, related to the content of this project’s Impact part, the proposal has a complete introduction of objective information about the project, as well as the development potential of the smart contract that you will use. But if possible, please add a few lines to describe precisely how this contract works (e.g., what will be in the contract, what the terms will be or if there are any restrictions). And I also hope you can explain more about how you will protect users' personal information when they participate in betting.
Finally, and also the reason why I give this part 3 points. I'm commenting as a non-expert in this field, or possibly because you haven't been clear on this, and I haven't been able to understand. Unfortunately, I didn't see the connection between the project and the problem that the challenge posed. Will ADABet be able to “create a positive developer experience that helps the developer focus on building successful apps”? This is simply a new generation of betting and does not help developers unleash their creativity and expand their business model. If I'm wrong, please prove it by clarifying the link between your project and the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: In general, I appreciate the seriousness of your team, when you can make quite specific lists, with the necessary activities for each month, the cost calculated by time and the self-introductions very attractive of the members. A project led by such a great team will indeed create confidence for investors. However, I regret that you still make the same mistake with most of the projects I've reviewed, that you only list the to-dos, not describe how you will do them, with what human resource allocation and what technologies or expertise will be required to make them happen. So please feel free to add more.
f6_assessments.q2: I will not say too much about this part because there is really nothing to comment on. With a project full of enthusiasm like this, I hope your team can concretize bullet points with exact numbers and KPIs. I don't know how many times I have to write the following line, but I still want to repeat it so that you can correct this mistake. Investors are always interested in specific quantitative metrics and clear goals rather than just “numbers” or “amount”. Please consider adding them to your Auditability part.
